title: Pixel PROJECT: Fiora Portrait

embed.description: Because the new Project skins are badass, I'm gonna try to do portraits of them. Here's Fiora! League of Legends is owned by Riot Games. PROJECT: Fiora - Pixel Version

body: The new PROJECT skins are pretty badass and Fiora has for a long time been one of my favorite champions so I decided to make a pixel art portrait of her. If I have the time I might do the other ones, too.

replies.body:
I like it!

I do think that it's one of those images that rewards careful and prolonged examination - which is both a great thing, and exposes a minor weakness.  For example, when I first glanced at it, it was a little difficult to resolve what was going on.  I think when I hear artists talking about such things, they talk about 'first reads' and trying to make the initial shape language clearer.

Of course, now that I've looked at it longer, I can't even NOT see it as Project: Fiora, so it's really hard to describe the difficulties I was having.  Like looking at one of those rabbit/duck optical illusions :D

Apart from that, I think it's great - you've done such a great job conveying the character despite such a limited palette and resolution.  The thumbnail in particular shows just how nice it looks!
I agree; it took me a moment to parse the image. After that, though, it looks great.

I like the gray colors, though the reds are a bit oversatured imo. Nicely done.
The more I look at it, the more I like it. I dabble in pixel art from time to time, and I admire the shading and detail that shows through in the thumbnail.
